title: ‘Ghosts? I used to be a sceptic...’: Author Sarah Perry on her encounters with the supernatural
text:
Novelist Sarah Perry used to read scary stories to spook herself – but then the terrors started to attend her unasked

I do not believe in ghosts, but I am afraid of them. It has largely been a delicious fear, cultivated against a natural fearlessness: since there’s no dark alley I won’t willingly walk down at midnight, if I’m to encounter terror I must do so by seeking out artificial ghosts. It has always been this way. Once, I recall, my mother came home to find me reading The Omen on the kitchen floor, unable to make my way to my room until the book was finished – and even then, the schoolboy Antichrist lacked the nerve to follow me upstairs.

But lately I’ve found ghosts and terrors attending...
